channel.title: Jupyter on harshcurious
channel.description: Recent content in Jupyter on harshcurious

item.title: JupyterLab Python Environments
item.description: Adding Environments to JupyterLab Source: https://janakiev.com/blog/jupyter-virtual-envs/ Activate the environment: conda activate my_env Install ipykernel in your environment. Using: pip install --user ipykernel conda install -c conda-forge ipykernel Run the following to add the current kernel1 to jupyterlab installation in base environment: python -m ipykernel install --user --name=udemy-data-science Removing Environments from JupyterLab Check the list using: jupyter kernelspec list Remove a kernel using: jupyter kernelspec uninstall myenv So don’t forget to activate the environment first.
